summary: Email chain between defense attorney Roy Black and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding scheduling a discussion about the performance of Jeffrey Epstein's criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement. The exchange shows coordination between the defense and prosecution regarding the agreement's implementation.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Attorney being contacted by a federal prosecutor to discuss the Jeffrey Epstein case, specifically the performance of the Non-Prosecution Agreement. He indicates he is out of town in California.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement being discussed between the defense attorney and the prosecutor.

connections.description: Roy Black is acting as defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, as evidenced by the prosecutor contacting him to discuss Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Scheduled Discussion on Epstein NPA
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney attempts to schedule a call with defense attorney Roy Black to discuss the performance of Jeffrey Epstein's criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from July 30, 2008, concerning Jeffrey Epstein's criminal Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
Defense attorney Roy Black is coordinating with a federal prosecutor (Assistant U.S. Attorney) to discuss the 'performance' of the NPA.
The prosecutor's office is located at 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL.
The exchange indicates ongoing legal management and oversight of the controversial non-prosecution deal granted to Epstein.
